33. In your real life do you prepare for the apocalypse, stash stuff away? Preppers style!
Well I really shouldn't be letting people know how much impoverished or non-perishable food that I have like canned food and ramen noodles, because otherwise I will probably have to cope with a mob of raiders. But really I downloaded lots of books from torrents and they help to prepare for the worst, which is anything really basically. But unfortunately my machete got confiscated so I don't have much for weaponry, only just some tools like hammer, screwdriver, that's it about really. Maybe I can use my porn collection as for a distraction?? The only flammable I have is some spray paint that no one knows I have yet, it's better if it stays that way but I nearly got caught sometimes. I have a first aid kit and fire extinguisher but it's only a small hand sized one I got from a gas station. My walkie talkie is the closest I can get a radio. I have sake but thats for me to drink only, no other purposes under any circumstances. I have a bike for travel so I can't migrate without leaving cargo behind, this is my flaw so maybe I should save up for RV but it will only draw attract unnecessary and unwanted attention. I have a map but it isn't your kind of a map. Those books from torrents are my best asset, unless the power goes

33. In your real life do you prepare for the apocalypse, stash stuff away? Preppers style!

*laughs*
I own a digital library of survival books, including the CDC booklet and army stuff. If i ever get arrested, they will call me a potential madman^^
I know where the closest military installations, survival shelters and stores for all kind of stuff are. There never is less than 2 weeks-rations of food in my home; i just recently though about a faradys cage made by a friend of mine, where i may store my netbook, i posess flares, a machete and military carrying equipment, 2 tents, a can of gasoline (got no car, but you have to be able to make cocktails if the world is going down^^), batons and stuff. No firearm, as having and storing them is to expensive atm. Still looking for radio equipment.
I cant be a real prepper, as i dont posess land, *sigh* ^^
WHY?
As my father was in civil war :/ , he told me "Son, every day something may happen; beeing prepared doesent hurt.". And ive seen how mad people go just by having a day without electricity, so i dont consider myself mad.

46. Have you ever had a problem with griefers? Do you thinkbinto and Grinch should be Griefer sherriffs?

Personally, no, I meta so I don’t really have to suffer their grief but for people that don’t get a chance to or don’t like to Meta jump I think there should definitely be more done about the griefing. Having somebody active with their head screwed on that wont let personal grudges cloud their judgement of what exactly constitutes griefing vs. selfish play would benefit the community and the developers. Im sure theres plenty of people that just started the game to find themselves punched on day 1 by some idiot that ran off into the desert to die and do the same the next day in a different town to somebody else. How likely are these people to stick at a game that’s difficult to get the hang of in the first place, never mind shell out hard earned cash for hero days.

Griefer sherrifs is a fine idea.

9. How old is too old for food?
Believe in expiry dates?
Will you eat food dropped on the floor?
Perhaps if you blow it off?
Would it be different in Apocalypse times?

I already eat food that was dropped on the floor, depending on the kind of floor.. if it was tar, for example, i wouldnt eat it NOWADAYS. Common dust is not deadly NOWADAYS

Everything that is canned or vacuum sealed can be eaten safely far beyond the expiry date, as long as it was stored properly and the seal not broken; a bent can can be considered unsealed.

In the case of a radiation event, or actually always, over-the-date food should be cooked; ideally in a decontaminated container (by cooking decontaminated water in it) with decontaminated (cooked) water. It is important to use safe fire (meaning, not radiated wood, for example).
This reduces radiation and bacteriea.

The quickest way to check if food is still good, is to smell it and taste it. Our body handles known food issues by itself; meaning that a bad smelling food should not be eaten.. unless you want to have the worst diarhea in your life. Tasting is a method for the brave, admittingly.

Inside hordes, i consider the apocalypse to have happened "recently".. finding edible, unpacked food?

Unknown to most people, fuel has an expiry date too.. it turns into a goo, unhandelable for most engines and ruining engines if left inside them.

GrinchOnce in school our teacher asked who had a Mammal in house. Many people, including me, raised their hands (eveyrone has a cat or dog or something). Then she asked who had Birds. Very few people this time, but I raised my hand. Then she asked about Fishs. Again me and a few people raised hands. Reptiles? Just me, Anphibians? Just me.

You ever have a tarantula? I got one years ago to help me overcome my fear of spiders. I worked up the courage to touch its legs and abdomen many times and it really did help with my fear. Small spiders didn't bother me anymore.

One day as I was about to leave to go to work I heard a loud crash. My dog had knocked over the aquarium the spider was in. The glass shattered but somehow the tarantula was ok. I still think of what might have happened had she knocked it over when I wasn't home.

Anyway, weeks or months later when I was "petting" the tarantula's abdomen it lunged up at me and bared its fangs. Scared the @*#& out of me and I mentally regressed to the point where I was before I ever got the thing. I'm still terrified of spiders.

14. How can you really carry a whole sackful of wrought iron when its really heavy! ?

Game characters have access to a magical space in their inventories where they can carry objects without weighing them down. Haven't you seen those game characters that can carry 10 rocket launchers and machine guns in their inventory and draw them from thin air? The problem is that this magical space is limited by the number of items you can carry, similar to how a rocket launcher uses as much space in the inventory as a small key.

64. Tell us one good quality about being a zombie ( be creative) ?

No pain, no need to achieve anything.. no suffering.. nothing is right or wrong.. no morals, no past, no future. Just prey, and the hunter. I like the concept of ghouls. Sneaky citizens who make their moves in the shadow while projecting a normal citizen image as a front. It takes a pretty smart player to play as a ghoul, and an equally smart citizen to catch him/her.

The problem, though, is that reality is far away from that concept. Most ghouls are either jerks who just want to annoy the rest of the citizens. And it doesn't help that most citizens are so apathetic that prefer to sit idle while their neighbors are being eaten, or overreact and start a witch hunt that seldom goes well.

WalkinCrow

61. Would you go looting in a real zombie apocalypse, where would you go first?

I wouldn't go looting. There is nothing I need so bad that I would risk getting killed or wounded by a desperate fool. I may steal some gas for my camp stove so I'm not given away by smoke but I can steal that from lawn mowers, abandoned cars and such.
I would head straight to the tree line behind my house. From there I can make it to Daniel Boone National Forest without leaving the cover of trees, except for crossing some roads. I'm perfectly able to survive long term in the woods with nothing but a pocket knife. I have all the comforts too, if I have time to gather it when the stuff hits the fan, left over from my days of long distance (multi-month) hiking.
TL;DR - So long suckers!

35. Would you ever live in a bunker underground? DO you know what a faraday room is? would you have one?

Uh, check my profile pic, does that answer your question?

If it does not, yes I would. In a heart beat. It would protect me from nukes and the Great War of 2077 .

Faraday: A Faraday cage or Faraday shield is an enclosure formed by conducting material or by a mesh of such material. Such an enclosure blocks external static and non-static electric fields by channeling electricity through the mesh, providing constant voltage on all sides of the enclosure. Since the difference in voltage is the measure of electrical potential, no current flows through the space. Faraday cages are named after the English scientist Michael Faraday, who invented them in 1836.

So yes, I know now, thanks to Wikipedia ! It would be nice to have one. Like if the family visited and I didn't want to talk to anyone, and just wanted to play Die2Nite and watch Netflix. I'd lock myself in, and wait it out. I'd make sure to have it stocked full of Coca-Cola, Goldfish [the SNACK], and air conditioning .
